page.title: 13Religion
page.content: There is a church in Cock Clarks and the village of Purleigh is served by a church lying just outside our block. There is also a chapel and some residents expressed regret at the closure of another chapel. In our survey we found that a third of all the people we spoke to attended church at least occasionally. As various activities seem to be tied to the church, this may account for the rather high proportion of people who actually go to church. We found a tiny, seemingly isolated cemetery which was once attached to the now demolished chapel. Although most of the graves were old, the eldest dated 1793, there was a recent grave of 1980.
